thread.title: “K-Pop Star 6” Under Fire For Broadcasting Sexualized Performances From Minors
thread.title_full: “K-Pop Star 6” Under Fire For Broadcasting Sexualized Performances From Minors

author: JiwonYu
title: “K-Pop Star 6” Under Fire For Broadcasting Sexualized Performances From Minors
text:
Shares 520 Display.Sharethrough.Soompi.1x1 
SBS’s audition program “K-Pop Star 6” has been reported to the Korea Communications Standards Commission subcommittee for sexual content. 
On March 14, the Korea Communications Standards Commission stated, “‘K-Pop Star 6’ has made a minor wear a school uniform and perform a sexual song that includes suggestive lyrics. Many civil complaints were submitted especially after the February 5 and 12 broadcast.” 
During the specific episodes, the 11-year-old contestant Han Byul came out wearing a school uniform and performed Britney Spears’“Oops! I Did It Again.” When it aired, viewers criticized the show, saying, “It was uncomfortable to watch a child perform such a sexual song while wearing a school uniform.” 
A source from the Korea Communications Standards Commission also added, “The show will be reevaluated for making minors perform songs with such provocative lyrics, which violates section 45 article 6 of the broadcasting review regulations.” The Korea Communications Standards Commission will be reviewing the show on March 15 at 3 p.m. KST. 
Check out the latest episode of “K-Pop Star 6” below: 
What are your thoughts on this issue?
